DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Begin Less Initial Pathologic Diagnosis Date Calculated Day Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Time interval from the first day of a person's radiation therapy treatment to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Begin Subtract Diagnosis Time Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins._The act of removing a part from the whole._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.:The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Begin Subtraction Diagnosis Time
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins._The act of removing a part from the whole._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.
The act of removing a part from the whole.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Property.preferredDefinition: The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The period of time during which something continues.

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 2023.7.24 Updated def for 'No Value Exists'. ak

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours._The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Calculation created for TCGA content requested by Dr. Ari Kahn.  This VD uses a calculation of dividing a value by the number of milliseconds in a day (86,400,000) to result in a number of days, stored as a whole number.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: CDDP/CTSP (Cancer Driver Discovery Program/Clinical Trial Sequencing Project)
